original: dang por sems can thams cad sgrol ma'i mtshan nyid kyis snying rje rnam par bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang por sems can thams cad sgrol ma'i mtshan nyid kyis snying rje rnam par bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: First, one should cultivate compassion for all sentient beings through the characteristics of Tārā.

original: phyi dang nang du byas pa stong pa nyid du yang dmigs la /🔽bar snang la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge aam las gri gug go //
analyzed: phyi dang nang du byas pa stong pa nyid du yang dmigs la / bar snang la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la yi ge aam las gri gug go //
translated: One should also visualize emptiness as external and internal.🔽In the sky, from the syllable aṃ, there is a curved knife.

original: de'i chad zung du zla ba la yi ge aam bsam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i chad zung du zla ba la yi ge aam bsam par bya ba'o //
translated: In its handle, on a moon, one should imagine the syllable aṃ.

original: de las rnal 'byor ma'i spro ba dang bsdu ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: de las rnal 'byor ma'i spro ba dang bsdu ba la sogs pa /
translated: From that, the emanation and gathering of yoginīs, and so forth,

original: de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pa las ro'i snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bdag med ma zhal gcig ma /
analyzed: de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pa las ro'i snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bdag med ma zhal gcig ma /
translated: all of that completely transforms into a corpse. At the heart of the corpse, on a moon disk, is Nairātmyā, who has one face

original: sku mdog mthing nag / thod pa dang / kha tv'am bsnams pa'i phyag gnyis ma bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: sku mdog mthing nag / thod pa dang / kha tv'am bsnams pa'i phyag gnyis ma bsam par bya ste /
translated: and is imagined to have two hands, which hold a skull cup and a khaṭvāṅga.

original: dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum ma /
analyzed: dmar zhing zlum pa'i spyan gsum ma /
translated: She has three eyes, which are red and round.

original: dbu skra ser po gyen la brdzes pa'o//
analyzed: dbu skra ser po gyen la brdzes pa'o//
translated: Her yellow hair stands on end.

original: mgo dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga rnams la ni aom a'a: h'um gi yi ge rnams so //
analyzed: mgo dang / mgrin pa dang / snying ga rnams la ni aom a'a: h'um gi yi ge rnams so //
translated: At the head, throat, and heart are the syllables Om, Ah, and Hum.

original: snying ga'i zla ba'i gri gug gi yu ba'i zla ba la yi ge aam bltas la sngags bzlas par bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba'i gri gug gi yu ba'i zla ba la yi ge aam bltas la sngags bzlas par bya ba'o //
translated: Looking at the syllable Am on the moon at the handle of the flaying knife at the heart, one should recite the mantra.

original: aom aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo aam sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom aa a'a ai a'i au a'u ri r'i li l'i ae aee ao aoo aam sv'a h'a /
translated: Om am ah aa i ee u uu ri ri li li e ai o au am svaha.
This is the mantra for recitation.

original: bdag med ma'i sgrub thabs so /
analyzed: bdag med ma'i sgrub thabs so /
translated: This is the sadhana of Nairatmya.

original: // / aa bha ya las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / aa bha ya las dge slong tshul khrims rgyal mtshan gyis bsgyur ba'o//
translated: By Abhaya. Translated by the bhiksu Sthiramati.
